content.description:
Sit start with a great left hand undercling and a right pinch on the arete. From there, crank up through edges to reach an easy mantel.

It is tough putting a grade on a problem like this, the first move requires a fair amount of torque, from there it climbs relatively easily.
content.protection: A pad will do. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the west face of the boulder.

content.description: Stand start with your choice of edge, and climb straight up through generous edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad. The landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's west face.

content.description: Sit start matched on the shelf. From there, traverse right along the sloping nose, eventually gain a right hand sidepull, reach the lip, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. There is a good landing, but a tree stump sits behind the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the northwest section of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start with a featured edge and a high-pasted foot. From there, gain a right hand edge, place a left heel, slap the left hand up the arete, and finish the remainder using chickenheads.
content.protection: A pair of pads, but the landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's southeast face.

content.description: Sit start with a pair edges at the hueco. From there, place a heel, make a big move to a right hand pinch, follow to the corner jugs, press onto the south-facing slab, and finish up the remainder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the southwest portion of the boulder.

content.description: Stand start with your choice of edge. From there, climb straight up through thin edges to reach a featured finish.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's west face.
